titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: Report of Court Martial—
Swamps—and ignorance of that topography.
Friday 13 Octr 1837 J. H. Causten's Memorial and Documents—to be printed—
3. IV:30: Sunday— Harriet Livermore— Luke 23.34. Cogswell
Mrs Frye— Miss C. E. Johnston
4 V. Monday— Comee. Manufactures— H.R.U.S— Petns— Massachusetts Resolutions— Indian hostility bill past—home at 8.
Rain— Caldwell.
5— V.— Whittlesey— Territorial Bills.— Ioway— Wisconsin
Waddy Thompson—Crary, Jones, Mercer—Pope—Everett, Charles Shepard—Bronson— Comee. J. Sergeant Chairman— At Caldwell’s— Briggs— National Intelligencer Office
Gales— Evening Note
6. IV:15. Wednesday
Heavily Showery day— Coughs— H.R. Reports of Comee. Iron Steamboats
Territory of Ioway— Bond— Mercer
Arrested in my Speech— Wisconsin— Florida— Texas— adjourn at 5. Mr Frye— Letter from James Biddle— Jos. H. Adams— [symbols]
7. IV:31. Thursday—

Comee. Manufactures— H.R.— Reports of Comees. Surveys of Lakes &c— Resn passed— Territorial Bills— Pre-emption Bill, preferred to North-eastern Boundary— Many Amendments— Comee. rose— Walk with G. Kemble— Letter from Charles at Boston— Silsbee— Peace between Biddle and Downing.

8— IV:15. Friday— Dr Thomas. Mrs A. very ill— H.R.U.S.— Treasury building Bill— Dr. Perrine— Sereno Dwight— Sherwood— Fairfield— Numerous Bills passed 3d. reading— Hot walk home— Evening visit from N. Silsbee

9. IV:30 Saturday— Fahrenheit 90— Met Dr Sherwood and Sereno Dwight— Dr Perine— Cushing— Magnetical Longitude— Cushing, H.R.U.S— Many private Bills passed. Claim 60 years old— Virginia protested Bill Comee of the whole struck out interest— House concur 86. to 55. adjourn just after 2— Talk with Isaac Fletcher andWilliams. rode home— Evening roasted.
10. V. Sunday— Fowler Romans 5.6. with Fanny— St. John’s— Mr Hawley. Isaiah 11.9. Miss Johnston— N. Frye— Trinity Sunday Fahrenheit 122 and 85—

11— IV:15. Monday— Elizabeth Pierce . . . Comee. of Manufactures—only Slade and me.— H.R.U.S— Kilgore’s small Bills and Treasury Circular— William Wickham— My Resolution— Senate Bills 147. 175–176— failed 61 to 68— Petition from the workmen—presented— Treasury building Bill—laid on the table 94 to 91.— District of Columbia Bills— Repeated want of quorum. Bills, carried through— Isaac Fletcher and Son— Adjourned at 7—

12. IV:30— Tuesday— Dr. Sherwood and Sereno Dwight— Magnetic Discoveries in Comee Room of foreign Affairs— Cushing’s notice to me, of Dromgoole’s report— H.R.U.S— Grennell’s Resolution to take hereafter a daily recess from 2 to 1/2 past 3—adopted— Carter’s motion to suspend the rules for the Pension law faills— Whittlesey of penalty for non-attendance—dined with Whittlesey and Taliaferro in Comee. room— Call for Mary at Mrs Thornton’s— Pre-emption Bill— Visit to Dr Huntt— Mrs Frye—

13. IV.30. Wednesday— Mrs Stewart’s— Pension Office— Visit to Mr Silsbee—his daughters— Legare— H.R.U.S—his report on Petns of Peace Societies—10000 copies— Dromgoole’s on Texas Petns. Cushing— Sharp debate— Cushman’s previous question fails—hour expires— Pope— W. S. Smith out of Office— Pre emption Bill debate Cushing— Rice Garlard— Bill and Amendments reported to the House— Adjourn at 1/2 past 8— Intense heat.

14. IV:15. Thursday— Comee Manufactures— H.R.U.S. Morning hour consumed in motions for suspension— Howard. W. Thompson’s Amendment. Texas— Pre-emption Bill— Senate— Webster— North-eastern boundary— Buchanan— Recess—excessive heat— Pre-emption Bill passed— adjourn after 9.
15. IV:15. Friday.

H.R.U.S— I offered two Resolutions—amendments to Waddy Thompson’s— Amendment. Howard’s Speech— I took the floor— Hour expired. Question to Howard and Speaker—answers— Orders of the day— Hoffman— Private business— Recess— Daveis in Committee room of Comee. of Manufactures— Call of the House exact Quorum— Vigo— Heilemann— Call on me by Bigelow, for the heirs of Casaux— Indiana Quakers— Rariden— Adjourned at 7—

16. IV. Saturday— H.R.U.S. Morning hour— I began— reached reference to Journal p. 65— Dromgoole. Howard— Legare—expiration of the hour—private business— Orders of the day— Steam-boat explosion Bill—my attention otherwise directed— Library— Jeffersons Works Vol. 3.— Recess at 2. Party at Coll. Towson’s to taste wines— Horticultural Society— G. Kemble went with me— P.U.S.— Woodbury— Poinsett— Dickerson— Jesup— Polk. Senators &c— Dined with G. Kemble— Howard— Latrobe— Afternoon Session— Daveis— Adjourned 1/2 past 6— Marine Band— Walk home—
17. IV. Sunday— Heard Fowler from John 12:32. A Stranger from Isaiah 55.6— Hawley read prayers for 1st. Sunday after Trinity— Letter from Mr Frye.

18. III.45. Monday.— Call at Mr Frye’s Office— Comee Manufactures— Bill— H.R.U.S— Reconsideration of reference of Blair’s Memorial. 3. hours— Petition of workmen—referred to Comee. on public buildings— Abington— My Resn. not received—recess— Post route Bill in Comee of the whole Davee in the Chair— Thunder Shower after heat adjourned past 8.
19. IV. Tuesday.

Three sets of workmen at the Capitol applied to me to obtain their wages during the suspension— H.R.U.S— I presented the second Petition—referred to Comee on Public building My Call on P.U.S. not received— Morning hour— Composition of Comee. of foreign Affairs Orders of the day— Comee. of the whole on the Union, Connor Chairman on the Sub-treasury Bill— Cambreleng, Pickens— Recess, Garland— Comee. rise— Union again. Davee Chairman— Post-Office Bill—debated—amended—reported to House—adjourned at 7. Theatre— Wedding day—V. Monier— Ion—Ellen Tree— W. R. King— C. S. Daveis— A. Campbell came home with me— Midnight

20. IV:15. Wednesday— Sun rose 4:34— Morning hour— State Dept. Mississippi report Texas Resolutions of State Legislatures— Rhode-Island— Alabama &c. Hamer asked my leave to present a petition—granted reminding him of his courtesy to me yesterday.— Sub-treasury— Garland’s Speech— Bronson’s Amendment Recess. In the Library—searching in vain for the Mississippi report.— After the recess— Dromgoole for the Sub-treasury— Prentiss began— Adjourned at 7— Walk home. Theatre—with my wife— Mary and Louisa— A. Campbell— The wife— Ellen Tree— Wedding d Youthful Queen— Kemble. Howard. Thin

21. V. Thursday— Comee. of Manufactures— H.R.U.S. Texas— Tillinghast and R.I. Resolns.— Cushing modifies— R.I. and Vermont Alabama Resns—my comment—Massachusetts—debate in Texian Legislature—interrupted reading Harlan— Sub Treasury— Connor Chairman— Duncan’s amendments— Prentiss till the recess and again two hours— Rhett— R. M. T. Hunter— Adjourned 6:30 Part walk home— Theatre, with Mrs. A. Mary—the two children— Campbell. Alarm of fire— The Love Chase and the Maid of Munster— Ellen Tree in both— Explosion of Steamer Pulaski— Southard. Railroad accident— Home at Midnight.
22. V.30. Friday—

Smithson, bequest. H.R.U.S— Texas— Morning hour— Sub-treasury— R. M. T. Hunter until and after the recess. J. P. Kennedy— Comee rise— Steamboat explosion Bill— Sundry Amendments— Constitutional objections—adjourn at 7:15. Workmen on the Public buildings— Govr. Lincoln— Monday— Ellen Good, a widow
23: IV:15. Saturday—

Miriam, the prophetess— timbrel All the women after her. Song— H.R.U.S— Morning hour— Texas— Slave petitioning— Speaker’s decision—my appeal— Speaker sustained 115 to 36. 205 members in the House— Reconsideration of Vote to postpone adjournment question— Resolution to adjourn 9. July passed— Independent Treasury Bill— J. P. Kennedy till and after the Recess— Toucey— W. Thompson— Potter— I left the House in Session at 1/2 past 7— Theatre— As you like it. Ellen Tree Rosalind— Fredericks Jaques— Pickering Touchstone— Youthful Queen— Towson’s— W. R. King. John and Nathl. Pope— Campbell came home with me at Midnight
24. V:15. Sunday.

St. John’s— Hawley read prayers for the 3d. Sunday after Trinity— Stranger preached from John 11:40. Spoke to P.U.S.— Mrs Frye here— Campbell dined with us. Afternoon Mr Hawley read prayers for the 2d. Sunday after Trinity, and preached from 1. Peter 1.18.19.— Call on P.U.S.—he read R. Rush’s Letter— Conversation concerning the Smithsonian bequest.— encouraging— Nathl. Pope here this Evening. and Dr Thomas— Fanny unwell. Dr. Huntt gone to the Virginia Springs.

25. V. Monday.— Comee. of Manufactures— Present Adams Naylor, Slade— No Quorum— Memorial of Dr H. H. Sherwood, House— Reading of the Journal— I claim the right to the floor when the Texas question comes up—admitted by the Speaker. Petrikin moves reconsideration of the Resn to adjourn 9. July— rule suspended— Previous question— Reconsideration—refused 64 to 135— Resolutions called—from Maine— I moved a call for the Newspaper—asked consideration now—refused 84 to 108. Recess, Letter to J. Meredith— P.M. Session— Sub-treasury. Rhett’s Speech— Enacting clause struck out in Committee of the whole— Previous Question— Engrossment of the Bill— Call of the House. Bill rejected 111 to 125. Foster gives notice of a motion to reconsider— Walk home—at 9.

26. V. Tuesday— H.R.U.S— Half an hour consumed in preliminary questions— Robertson Yeas and Nays— Texas— Pickens— Women— Scripture— Antient History—Greece—Sparta—Rome. Orders of the day— Reconsideration of vote against sub-treasury Bill—rejected 202 to 21— Bill to increase the army— Recess. Letter to J. Meredith P.M. M’Kay— G. Kemble— Comee. rise— Insupportable heat— Bills from Senate— Adjourn at 7. Walk home— The family visited Mr Johnson.
27. IV. Wednesday.
Pension Office

H.R.U.S— I gave up the morning hour, for Reports of Committees— They occupied two hours. I reported from the Committee of Manufactures a Bill—and obtained an assignment of one hour next Saturday immediately after the recess for the 3. Senate Bills, and the Bills reported by the Committee, now in Committee of the whole on the Union— Bill to increase the army debated till the recess and after till 1/2 past 7. Letters to Abbott Lawrence and G. S. Hillard— I presented 2 Petitions for Institution of a New Department— Referred to the Committee on Agriculture. Walk home— Mrs Thornton, Mrs Talbot and her daughter and Dr Perrine here.
28. IV. Thursday
Comee. of Manufactures—present Adams, Foster, Naylor, Tillinghast— Vail, Webster—

Letter from Secy Treasy. Rept from 1. Comptroller. Bleached linen, and worsted. further consideration postponed till Saturday. Naylor to report a Bill laying a duty of 2. Cents per lb on Starch. H.R.U.S— Morning hour on Texas— Women Petitioners— Howard not present— Orders of the day— Bill to increase the army. Bell till the recess— Letters to John Angier and Ragsdale P.M. Skirmishing debate— Lincoln, Reed, Evans, Everett, Grennell, Harrison of Missouri— Yell, many amendments— Comee. rise no Quorum— Comee. again— House refusing to adjourn— Amendment adopted— Bill reported to the House— Adjourn at 9 P.M. Heat insupportable— Ride home— Thunder shower—light— Fire in G. Street— Miss Grandval went off suddenly to join her brother at the Island of Guadeloupe— Speaker’s chair and seats in the House to be re-inverted
29. IV:34. Friday

Grymes came to exchange Bank Bills Borland to make a chest for papers— H.R.U.S. yielded the floor to Bouldin, Chapman, Worthington &c—till scarcely a quarter of an hour was left. Texas— Woman— Howard— Aspasia— Deborah Gannett— Army Bill—till the recess and till 9. P.M— New Regiment of Infantry— Reconsideration— Briggs and Reed vs Evans and Cushing— Bill engrossed with Amendments for 3d. reading 107 to 77. Library— Aspasia— Fillmore— Jefferson’s writings Vol. 1— Heat. Seat at the windows.— Part walk home
30. IV:15. Saturday

Comee. of Manufactures. present Adams, Biddle, Foster, Naylor, Slade, Tillinghast, Webster. Letter from Secy Treasy and Report of 1st. Comptroller resumed. Dr. Dwight— H.R.U.S. Morning hour— Texas— Women, Misses Grimké, Pickens— Tissue of Misrepresentations—my reply— Legare’s call to order. Speaker decides against him— Campbell’s interruption, and my reply— The Constitutional question— Decn. of Independence— Constitution— People—Expiration of the hour— Elmores imputation of insane raving— Potters account of proceedings in Pennsylvania Legislature— Noyes’s motion to confine speakers to 15 minutes—laid on the table. Kilgore and Cushman—motions to suspend the rules fail— Rules suspended for the army Bill— Carter’s motion to recommit with instructions—wide and desultory debate till the recess— After the recess— One hour had been assigned for the Bills from the Comee on Manufactures— Comee. of the whole on the Union— Owens in the Chair—five bills—reported to the House, and two more from the Comee. of Ways and Means— Naylor’s scruple— Cambreleng starts an objection and the hour expires— Tennessee land-Bill—assigned at 1/2 past 4. Shields— Lewis Williams— North-Carolina members— Bill reported to the House rejected by yeas and nays 92 to 53—and Martin moves a reconsideration— Attempt to take up army Bill fails— Adjourn at 7.45. Walk home— Thunder shower in recess Campbell here
